Description: Rough hemispheric hollow lump of iron slag with inclusions of charcoal and ceramic chips, from the bottom of a hearth for iron working.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Tell Dafana, SE quarter of the Saite enclosure (so-called "Camp").
Curator's comments: Very probably the "complete crucible bottom of slag mixed with charcoal" coming from the SE quarter of the enclosure, mentioned by W.M.F. Petrie, Tanis ii, Nebesheh and Defenneh, p. 79 § 78. See also London, BM, GR 1888,0208.170 and Boston, MFA RES 87.84.
Bibliographic references: Petrie 1888 / Tanis. Part II. Nebesheh (Am) and Defenneh (Tahpanhes) (p. 59 § 57, p. 79 § 78)
Leclère and Spencer 2014 / Tell Dafana Reconsidered: The Archaeology of an Egyptian Frontier Town (p.47, p.89, p.142-143, p.142, fig.1, p.188, pl.30)
